snippet: Violence killed at least 11 people and threw the race into disarray as some candidates blamed the military for the deaths and said they were halting their campaigns.
abstract: Assailants attack protesters staging a sit-in near Egypt's Ministry of Defense in Cairo, killing at least 11 people, setting off hours of clashes and throwing the coming presidential election into disarray; at least five candidates announce the suspension of their campaigns to protest the deaths; episode widens a rift between Egypt’s military rulers and protesters who are pushing for a speedy transition to a civilian government.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: Violence killed at least 11 people and threw the race into disarray as some candidates blamed the military for the deaths and said they were halting their campaigns.

headline.seo: Deadly Clashes Erupt in Egypt Ahead of Vote
headline.main: Fierce Clashes Erupt in Egypt Ahead of Presidential Vote
headline.print_headline: Deadly Clashes in Egypt Throw the Presidential Race Into Disarray

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
